message.content:
cs.SD, cs.MM, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.LG

The paper deals with speaker diarization in TV series, which involves analyzing audio and video data to identify who is speaking when. This task involves several subfields of computer science, including speech processing (cs.SD), multimedia (cs.MM), computer vision (cs.CV), natural language processing (cs.CL), and machine learning (cs.LG). Given the focus on audio and video analysis, cs.SD and cs.MM are the most likely categories, followed by cs.CV for the visual analysis component. The use of clustering algorithms suggests a machine learning component, which could fall under cs.LG. Finally, the mention of dialogue scenes and natural language processing suggests a possible connection to cs.CL.
